key_questions_answered.user_types: Developers/Engineers (Python API users), CLI Users (command-line tool users), MCP Tool Consumers (systems/AI agents using MCP tools), Bot Systems (other bots like story_bot that use story_io for story map operations)
key_questions_answered.key_goals: Developers: Programmatically build, render, and synchronize story maps; manipulate story map components. CLI Users: Execute story map operations from command line. MCP Tool Consumers: Integrate story map operations into workflows via MCP protocol. Bot Systems: Automate story map creation and management as part of larger workflows
key_questions_answered.primary_users: Primary: Story Bot (uses story_io for story map operations). Secondary: Developers building story map tools or integrating story maps. Tertiary: Teams/individuals who consume the story maps created by the system
key_questions_answered.first_action: Load/create a story graph (JSON format) and render it to DrawIO diagram (render_outline), or synchronize from existing DrawIO (synchronize_outline)
key_questions_answered.problems_solved: Manual story map creation/drawing, lack of programmatic story map management, difficulty keeping DrawIO diagrams and JSON data in sync, no automated way to extract story maps from visual diagrams, inability to search/manipulate story maps programmatically
key_questions_answered.struggles_delays: User confirmed all answers - specific workflow pain points not detailed but general problems addressed
key_questions_answered.integration_systems: DrawIO (XML format) for rendering and synchronizing, JSON for story graph data format, MCP Protocol for MCP server integration, File System for reading/writing story graph JSON and DrawIO files
key_questions_answered.integration_behaviors: JSON ↔ DrawIO bidirectional sync (render JSON to DrawIO, sync DrawIO back to JSON), Story Graph → Render (JSON → DrawIO XML with layout preservation), DrawIO → Extract (DrawIO XML → Story graph JSON extracting structure), Merge (compare extracted JSON with original, merge preserving metadata like Steps)
